definitions.definition: The idea that a given text is a response to what has already been written , be it explicit or implicit .
examples: When one studies the intertextuality of "Hamlet", one realises that William Shakespeare must have read thousands of books.

definitions.definition: The reference to another separate and distinct text within a text.

main_definition: The idea that a given text is a response to what has already been written , be it explicit or implicit .
secondary_definitions: The reference to another separate and distinct text within a text.
